results.title: 'Remembrance of things past'...a watercolour memoir for Richard
results.brief_description: When Judith recalls Richard’s legacy, she sees it through his watercolour paintings that stand as a aesthetic record to his life, from his childhood to his adult academic pursuits.

results.title: Contexts of development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses the theory of “context” where each child is unique (biological context), but part of the environment (immediate, socio-economic and cultural contexts).

results.title: George and Toula
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A portrait of a marriage within the Greek community. George is Greek-born and Toula second-generation Australian. Toula has had a tertiary education and works in social services. She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.

She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.

results.creator_credit: Eulea Kiraly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Looking Back
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
results.description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
description_for_label: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.

results.title: Murawina: self help
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Murawina is an Aboriginal pre-school in Chippendale, an inner suburb of Sydney. The Aboriginal mothers who run Murawina want a separate pre-school for their children, because they want to develop in their children a black pride that may not be encouraged by the white schools the children will next go to. The film raises questions about prejudice, the influence of past experiences on present day attitudes and the relationship between urban and tribal Aborigines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
